Application_Facts: Applicant claimed persecution as a homosexual in Mexico
Incidents were found to be isolated
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of Refugee Protection Division's decision
Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of persecution due to sexual orientation
Legal_Standard: Reasonableness for mixed questions of fact and law
Credibility_Assessment: Board questioned evidence regarding formal complaint
Found inconsistencies or lack of corroboration
Evidence_Used: Details of alleged incidents in Mexico
Application_Basis: Well-founded fear of persecution under the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Evidence_Assessed: Lack of police report or formal complaint
Governing_Rule: Standard of review: patent unreasonableness and reasonableness
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of documentary evidence for complaint
Harm_Assessment: Risk of harm due to homosexuality in Mexico
Cause_Description: Persecution based on sexual orientation in Mexico
Evidence_Handling: Board assessed credibility and sufficiency of evidence
Evidence_Assessment: Incidents not rising to level of persecution
Decision_Rationale: Isolated incidents do not constitute persecution
Internal flight alternative exists within Mexico
Legal_Standard_Applied: Reasonableness standard for mixed law and fact
